long: Meaning: to "rest", i.e. "settle" down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to "dwell", "stay", "let fall", "place", "let alone", "withdraw", "give comfort", etc.).  Usage: cease, be confederate, lay, let down, (be) quiet, remain, (cause to, be at, give, have, make to) rest, set down. Compare "H3241".  Source: a primitive root;
